intro: Boerlagiodendron tricolor, commonly known as the three-colored boerlagiodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its strikingly colorful foliage, which displays three distinct colors on its leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
